summary: This bill, the Strengthening Capacity for Disaster Resilient Territories Act, mandates the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) to establish a Territorial Disaster Recovery Program. The program aims to identify, monitor, and address factors and gaps hindering recovery efforts in U.S. territories after major disasters.  It includes technical assistance, training, best practices development, and collaboration with local experts.  The bill also requires reports to Congress and authorizes $50 million annually for fiscal years 2026-2030 to fund the program.
